title: 33.2 Determining Whether Any Pair of Segments Intersects
content:
Section 33.2

Determining Whether Any Pair of Segments Intersects

Summary

Sweep line algorithm for detecting intersections.

Key Points

  • Sweep line: vertical line moving left to right
  • Event points: segment endpoints
  • Active segments: those currently crossing sweep line
  • Maintain sorted order of active segments
  • Check only adjacent segments for intersection

Example

n segments: sort 2n endpoints, process left to right. At each event, update active set and check neighbors.

Why It Matters

O(n log n) vs O(nÂ²) naive algorithm.
